intro: Guettarda steyermarkii f. pilosior, commonly known as the pilosior guettarda, is a shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically leathery and have a glossy appearance, while its stems are covered in fine, silky hairs. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
